reviews.sentence: Good for one night. Not much more. I have stayed here several times and it is ok if you are getting in late and just want a bed but it is a poor representation of a Mariot courtyard. The walls are thin the lobby does not have an open market the decor is in need of update Etc. the staff is ok but not truly Mariot quality. Not sure where the glowing reviews come from unles it is people enamored with the lower price versus nearby offerings. I am completing a 5 night stay and will not do anything more than a single night in the future due to the above. Would rather pay 5 10 more a night for a better experience.
The rooms were not updated and dirty. The carpets were stained and bathrooms not well maintained. Was really shocked it belonged to the Mariot group of hotels. The staff were very friendly.
This is a 2 star hotel needs a major renovation staff nice but it was old and dingy.

And they call this a Level 3 hotel. With the service level I received at this Level 3 property you would have thought I was category 9 location. I have never ben treated more kindly serviced so well and enjoyed a breakfast buffet that was a 10. Melissa at the front desk was awesome. I had to extend my stay. no problem. I showed up a day early. no problem. This team of employees are clearly being tasked to do more with less it is slightly obvious but then again what company is staffed appropriately anymore. I would strongly encourage you to book a stay here. If you have kids you will make out like a bandit breakfast is a memory maker for the kids if you are a savvy business person who wants to get great service and not break the budget book here. There was a travel desk that was not a sales pitch. It was consultative. There was a well stocked Hertz desk thereFre Shuttles to Disney limited options but save the 20 on parking at DisneyFre use of Luggage carts just ask. Wifi was FAST nd allowed me to surf and watch an amazon movie while there Water pressure great hot water instantlyHeating AC quiet ad controllable Small table and chairs on the small deck off my room. comfortableSuper easy access to 4 East and WestI am an extremely demanding consumer. This place DELIVERED. This was a pleasure trip and I wish I knew about this property the last 2 times I was in the Orlando area on business. Rooms kept clean cleaning staff was well spoken and professional. I hung a privacy tag ion my door and was quite surprised to see a note under my door offering to come later or to deliver supplies if I needed a refresh. The dining room hosted a class act clown during the weekend days. A true professional clown not just a guy who painted his face and called himself a clown. He was multi lingual at least 5 languages. He sung short songs in the childrens native language at least 4 languages that I heard in the two weekend mornings I was thereI am a business guy in my early 50s. Visiting grandkids who were doing the Disney week. loved coming home to this hotel each nighthow is this for having to reach for my only criticism. Most of the outlets were tired loose and I had to struggle to keep my phone charger to stay plugged in.

Disney Courtyard. Staff members are friendly and helpful. Location to Disney parks is ideal. Rooms are clean. Shuttle is a nice service. Breakfast is good and reasonably priced. Outdoor Pool is heated but we did not try it out. Built in the true original design of a courtyard Mariot. it is old rooms desperately need a remodel. Beds are hard. Not all King rooms have a pull out sofa but the staff accommodated us. Parking is inadequate.

Terrible hotel do not count on your reservation actually being held. We booked our reservation months in advance of our trip. When we arrived to check in the manager told us they had moved us to another hotel. When we asked why he started looking shifty and said uh I think there was a maintenance issue. After further questioning it became clear that they had overboked and they kicked us out in favor of someone paying a higher rate. When I asked what good it was to have a reservation the manager said and I quote A reservation does not guarantee a room. All we have to do is find you a room somewhere else and we have met our legal obligation. What a great way to start a vacation. The manager was rude lied to our face and they basically said we are not good enough to stay there since we booked with a discounted rate.

The hotel was in a very convenient area for traveling to Disney. Very clean and service was very friendly. Could use some updating but in good condition. The only things that bothered me was the room felt very humid and the refrigerator made a high pitched noise that I found annoying. It was easily resolved by unplugging the fridge as we were not going to use it. Overall we were happy with our stay.
Resort was nice. Our room seemed a little dated and needs renovations.

While the hotel was undergoing renovations it was still nice to be able to have a place to rest after a day at the parks. However keep in mind that it is a working construction site and even through they should have made it known there was plenty of wet paint.

Great stay. It was great the hotel is being redone so the paint and the rooms have been redone close to everything we were there for. Only down side is since they are redoing the hotel the parking is limited so if you get back to the hotel at night chances are that you will not find parking aside from the parking overall it was a great stay would book again.

So so but better options out there. I have n’t stayed at this property before. We were looking for a last minute getaway for the holiday weekend and although we found some of our usual favorite places available we took this location based on a better price. Lesson learned. Overall we had no major issues. Our room was clean or as clean as it could get and we felt safe. This is the most important detail to me when I travel. Check in was friendly and quick. All of the employees I saw were friendly and polite. But the property is definitely dated and our room and furnishings were very dingy worn out and simply over used. The atmosphere especially the bed felt like a motel and reading that the rooms are being renovated makes me hope that ours was not done yet. The elevator outside of our room was out of service leaving us to walk to the opposite end of our building. The staircase at this end exited outside which made that way equally difficult. We actually stayed a second night but opted to pack up and go to one of our usual places.

Great location with great staff. The hotel is undergoing a major transformation updating and renovating almost everything in sight which is great for such a great location. Excellent staff including Ty Jorge Rolando Desire Edie that care to make sure your stay is the best possible. Their service made us feel like we were staying at the Four Seasons or Waldorf Astoria. Great breakfast buffet at a very reasonable price.

The hotel is very nice renovated very clean all the staff was excellent Keysha is an excellent girl to sell park tickets very helpful well located close to Disney Universal Downtown Orlando very central to everything. I recommend to enjoy the good atmosphere of this hotel.
Good value clean renovated room great location. Location great for Disney Springs and getting to MCOQuen beds vs standard would be nice.

Completely Refurbished and Looks Great. The hotel has been completely refurbished and it turned out great. New beds new furniture new carpet new TV new vanity. Everything is new. The new beds are very comfortable. The front desk staff was very friendly and the bartender made a great cocktail. it is in a great location with many restaurants within walking distance. The rate was very reasonable. I will definitely be back again.

Our room was nice and newly renovated with a large Smart TV. Linens and pillows were very comfortable. Shower products were nice. Ice machine was convenient. The only thing that I would have something negative to say was that the parking fee was new and I did not know about it until we arrived.
The room was very nice updated. The staff was very nice and helpful.

Hidden gem close to Disney. The rooms are recently updated with large tvs mounted to the wall. The room we had also had a living room separated by a door to the double beds. This made things great when traveling with kids. We liked the room so much that we booked it again for our next trip to Disney in a few weeks. The front desk staff are the best Kelly Kelly P and Dana. Dana took care of everything including checking us in and booking our future stay. Kelly P answered our questions and ensured our stay was a great one. Thanks again to you both. Looking forward to staying here again on many future trips to Orlando.

It takes meto say that this place had excellent customer service and the management was wonderful even the complementary breakfast buffet was excellent they make eggs to order and omelets to order every type of breakfast food you can imagine and the rooms were clean and decently remodeled.
Renovated rooms with comfy bed. Huge new TV looks awesome. Great bar and drink menu as well.
